answers.answer: Your numbing pain in the arm areas and wrist sound like carpal tunnel syndrome to me. I too have that and have been through the surgery. What type of work do you do? As for the upper leg, more info would be needed as I have full leg and hip pain that has been diagnosed as pirformis syndrome. i would be happy to offer you any advice based on my experiences if you would like.

question: For the past few months, I have had a severe numbing pain almost like a charlie horse pain in my upper thighs, my forearms on the inside of the elbow & just recently in my wrists & palms of my hands.  Does anyone have any ideas to what this could be?  I'm pretty healthy, i work out regularly & eat good for the most part.  Diabetes does run in my family and that's kind of what I'm starting to think it may be.  Any idea's of advice?
title: Numbing pain in arms and legs
